item.title: A Minecraft Movie Launches ‚ÄúFor Your Consideration‚Äù Awards Campaign
item.content:encoded:
A Minecraft Movie is officially launching an awards campaign for consideration for upcoming ceremonies like the Academy Awards and Golden Globes. Yes, you read that right, and yes, it is official from Warner Bros. itself.

Released earlier this year, A Minecraft Movie brought the blocky world of Minecraft to live-action and the results were rather decent. However, the real success came from its large box office, which came as a result of successful marketing and internet memes. Now, there is now a chance we could hear ‚ÄúSteve‚Äôs Lava Chicken‚Äù sung on the Oscars stage or Jack Black thank ‚ÄòChicken Jockey‚Äô at his Golden Globes acceptance speech.

A Minecraft Movie Campaigning for All Major Categories, Including Best Picture and Actor

Warner Bros. has launched campaigns for many of its films to be considered for end-of-year awards like the Academy Awards and Golden Globes. While some films, like the smash-hits Weapons, One Battle After Another, and Sinners, are among the names, one is a bit out-there: A Minecraft Movie. It‚Äôs not out there for movies, even okay ones, to do award campaigns, as it could snag some nominations if it‚Äôs lucky. However, Warner Bros. is putting everything up for the film, including it‚Äôs main cast and director.

The full list of contested categories can be found here. Notable ones include Best Picture, Jared Hess for Best Director, and Jack Black for Best Actor. Will it get any of those? Seeing how the race is, definitely not. However, personally, it does have a shot at Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Production Design, and Best Visual Effects. Depending on how some future movies do, you could even put ‚ÄúI Feel Alive‚Äù up there for Best Original Song.

While a weird campaign, it‚Äôs not surprising for Warner Bros. to do so. As mentioned before, A Minecraft Movie had a meteoric rise at the box office. In fact, it‚Äôs currently the third-highest-grossing film of 2025 behind Lilo & Stitch and Ne Zha 2. A sequel is already greenlit and in production as of earlier this month. Regardless, it‚Äôll be interesting to see if it leads anywhere and, if it does, it will be quite entertaining for sure.

item.title: EGX and The Death of the UK Gaming Expo
item.content:encoded:
The United Kingdom‚Äôs relationship with the video game expo scene has crumbled. Once upon a time, the nation boasted showcases like the Insomnia Gaming Festival, WASD, and EGX, but they‚Äôve all disappeared into the shadows over the years.

The Insomnia Gaming Festival went bust (and is trying a half-hearted resurgence), WASD shut down, and EGX has become a pitiful, almost unbranded corner in the larger MCM Comic Con in London. I attended EGX over the weekend, and I‚Äôm sad to say that it‚Äôs no longer worth keeping alive.

EGX‚Äôs disappearance marks the death of the UK gaming expo circuit.

UK Gamers Are Left to Dream(Hack)

Next year, DreamHack returns to the United Kingdom for the first time in ten years, which is a saving grace of sorts for gamers across the territory. In some places, the courageous efforts of more grassroots events like EPIC.LAN are trying to get some wheels turning, but the most iconic expos in the business have now faded into nothingness.

In 2024, the Insomnia Gaming Festival imploded after 25 years of entertaining visitors, thanks to financial woes brought on by the lingering impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. It‚Äôs trying to make a grand return in 2025, but it‚Äôs not looking good.

Also in 2024, the WASD showcase, a more intimate event in London that was one of my favorite events in the world, was shut down as the event‚Äôs organiser entered liquidation.

Now, I‚Äôm sad to report that EGX is done and dusted.

Farewell, EGX

Formerly known as the Eurogamer Expo, EGX was once the shining star of the UK gaming scene, a monumental event that drew international acclaim and hosted a showfloor featuring the biggest names in the business.

The COVID-19 pandemic wasn‚Äôt kind to EGX, but in the years that followed the devastation of the virus, EGX seemed to be getting back on an even keel. That growth has ebbed away into nothing, and EGX is now an unrecognizable corner of the larger MCM Comic Con event.

I attended EGX (for the last time) this year, and baulked at what was on display. It was almost impossible to spot any EGX branding, and what I did find was a few scattered indie games and a lone LAN area featuring a few rigs with a mix of playable titles on them. No big names, no exclusive demo opportunities, and almost nothing in the way of gaming activations.

In 2024, EGX and MCM joined forces, but the showcases were separated, and EGX still enjoyed a standalone profile that was represented in the branding of the event. This year, EGX has all but disappeared, leaving MCM standing tall ‚Äì but even that has issues.

As I walked around MCM, I was greeted by vast swathes of market-style stalls selling anime body pillow covers, mystery bags, animatronic furry tails, AI-generated art prints, and plastic toys aplenty. Amid a sea of half-baked cosplays and bored-looking event employees, I found none of my people; the gamers had failed to show out for EGX, what little of it there was.

Barely an Expo

The PR folks backing the event were offering me nothing but film and TV opportunities, and despite there being the likes of Troy Baker, Ben Starr, Chris Judge, Doug Cockle, Neil Newbon, and Elias Toufexis in attendance, nothing came up in a gaming capacity.

I made a conscious effort to request some kind of connection from the staff running the meet and greet area, and was palmed off with a ‚ÄòSorry, they don‚Äôt have time for that,‚Äô by a go-between messenger of an employee who failed to get me any traction from a nearby manager. I should stress that the manager who had ‚Äòno time‚Äô for me was plainly standing on the spot doing nothing.

With no games to play, no big-named exhibitors occupying the show floor, and there being nothing in the way of gaming activations, I was reduced to wandering the stalls and trying to get excited about merchandise (spoiler alert: I didn‚Äôt).

The panels were visited by a half dozen people every time someone was on the stage, the security staff were lacklustre and weren‚Äôt doing their job properly, and the busiest portion of the event seemed to always be the ‚Äòfood court‚Äô.

I can see EGX vanishing entirely next year, and while MCM will persist, it too has been reduced to something almost unworthy of a spot in your calendar. All eyes are now on Gamescom, an utterly phenomenal event that continues to expand year after year. I‚Äôve been to Gamescom twice and can stress that it‚Äôs the ultimate event in the world for gamers, and I just praise that it‚Äôs only a short flight away for me.

Elsewhere, gamers around the world can still enjoy events like Summer Game Fest, PAX, DreamHack, Tokyo Game Show, and other localized, regional events. If you want a regular expo in the UK, you‚Äôre out of luck and will need to travel.

Do you agree that the United Kingdom needs to do better in the gaming space? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1591: Hints And Answer For October 27, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1591 for October 27, 2025.

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you‚Äôve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 27, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1591 ups the difficulty from Sunday‚Äôs puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4.6 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it‚Äôs the same as the 4.2-guess average on October 26.

General Wordle Hints For October 27

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two different vowels.
  • Hint 2: It starts with F.
  • Hint 3: It describes something unpleasant to the nose.
  • Hint 4: It means foul-smelling. Think rotten or rancid.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1591 for October 27, 2025

Starter Words For October 27, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • DEFTS
  • FIRED
  • TIDED

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1591 On October 27, 2025

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: FETID

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1590 on October 26, 2025:

Answer: PLUMP

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1591?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 28 will be Wordle Game #1592.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: 40 Minutes of Wreckreation Gameplay Leaks Online
item.content:encoded:
A recent YouTube video has revealed 40 minutes of gameplay from Wreckreation, the open-world sandbox racer. Eagle-eyed gamers spotted the upload and have been poring over the gameplay, which shows a halfway-decent racer with destruction elements and arcade-like racing mechanics.

Wreckreation is set to drop on October 28, and I‚Äôm hoping for a solid day-one patch, as there are more than a few bugs in the gameplay video uploaded by ‚ÄòFlotutu‚Äô on YouTube.

Burnout in the Big 2025

We‚Äôve not seen a new Burnout game for more than 15 years, which feels pretty harrowing. Once upon a time, Burnout offered a high-octane, energetic racing experience punctuated with visceral crashes and takedown systems.

Wreckreation comes from the creators of the Burnout series, and it‚Äôs an all-new adventure set in a massive open-world map with sandbox mechanics. The game is designed to be pretty open-ended, offering multiplayer gameplay, stacks of customization, and some construction features that allow you to flex your imagination.

Here‚Äôs the video featuring the 40 minutes of Wreckreation gameplay that was uploaded recently:

As the gameplay unravels, prospective fans will spot a few bugs involving the game‚Äôs physics and destruction-based elements. At one point, the player crashes into a truck and glitches inside it, clipping like crazy until the game forces a cutscene.

It‚Äôs relatively safe to assume that a day-one patch will drop on October 28 alongside the launch of the game to address some of these lingering issues. That‚Äôs the problem with playing a game early; it‚Äôs often not representative of the final product.

It looks good enough, though. It‚Äôs mostly unlicensed and focuses more on high-speed, arcade action than realism, but that‚Äôs what people want from former Burnout developers.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Steam Player Count Spikes With New Mode
item.content:encoded:
A new mode for Marvel Rivals has caused a major player spike on Steam, its highest in a while.

Released in December 2024, the free-to-play multiplayer superhero shooter has been going steady. With the release of Season 4, which added Daredevil and Angela, the game has seen a decent, stable player base. While not as high as when its first season dropped, touting a 644,269 player count, it still ranks as one of the most popular games on Steam. In any case, earlier this week, the numbers rose quite a bit, heading into numbers only seen for the beginning of a season. Well, a new mode, one fans have been asking for for quite a while, has been added.

New PvE Marvel Zombies Mode Almost Doubles Marvel Rivals‚Äô Usual Player Count

According to SteamDB, earlier this week, Marvel Rivals kept at a usual 75k-80k player count, decreasing from the start of Season 4.5 with Daredevil. However, on October 23rd, the game spiked into the high 120k, almost double what it was the previous day. It continued into yesterday and today. The reason? The addition of the Marvel Zombies PvE mode lets players fight against AI enemies. Based on the comic and new animated series, the limited-time Halloween-based mode brings it to life with droves of zombies and perilous fights with friends.

A quick look at Reddit supports the rise quite well, as many fans have praised the mode a ton. Some, like Living-Ad102, want it to be a permanent addition to the game. Given that PvE has been asked for since the game‚Äôs release, the massive spike isn‚Äôt too surprising. If anything, it‚Äôs clear that NetEase may want to do more of these events. Either way, if you want in on the fun, best to do it before mid-November while Marvel Zombies lasts.

Read on to get the full scope of today‚Äôs NYT Connections hints.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today‚Äôs NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It‚Äôs relatively simple, and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It‚Äôs also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That‚Äôs in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What‚Äôs critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it‚Äôll be game over.
